name: BEST WESTERN Sault Ste. Marie

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel. Its modern, clean, well maintained and good for a longer term stay. Its location could best be described as in the "suburbs" of the town versus riverfront. As there are less establishments. Lots of fast food and an Applebees nearby with what you could call a small strip mall.
reviews.title: Sault Ste Marie, MI. Some tough choices but this is the better one

reviews.text: But again this is a very nice, clean well appointed hotel. The bed was very comfortable, internet service fast and reliable. The workout room is nice for a hotel/motel of this class. The pool also very nice. If the quality of the property ranks higher on your priority scale this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: First Class Stay

likes.liked: — First Class Room at a reasonable rate
likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything we did not like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as a last minute change in our travel plans and absolutely loved it! It is a newer (remodeled) hotel and very clean. Everything was great. We used the pool and exercise room. The breakfast was good for the entire family. I would highly recommend this hotel. The price was reasonable too!
reviews.title: Great 3 Day Stay

likes.liked: — The cleanliness and size of the room. Everyone I came in contact with were very friendly

reviews.text: My wife and I were going to attend the antique wooden boat show in Hessel, MI and then go to Mackinac Island. The hotel prices in Mackinaw City & St Ignace are well over $100 per night. I booked this hotel and got a much better rate. Even the extra drive to catch the island ferries did not add enough expense to warrant staying in Mackinaw or St Ignace. The hotel is great with clean rooms and helpful, friendly staff. They have a nice breakfast area with a more than adequate selection & it is attended by nice lady assigned to the area and not by front desk personnel as is the case at many places. Every night our room was quiet from the inside and out. This will be a must place to stay when we return to the area.
reviews.title: Great Family Stay

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, fridge & microwave provided, family laundry available

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extremely clean rooms, newer property. We found the best price at the hotel's website. Walmart was right across the street - a convenience we needed when our camera broke at the start of our trip. Drive to town and the Locks are about ten minutes, but a quick, easy drive. If you're planning to travel to the Falls or Whitefish Point, stay in Sault Ste. Marie and drive. We stayed in Paradise, MI and wished we had just stayed in the Sault. More to do, many more restaurants, and better prices. Be sure to stop at Clyde's Drive In for amazing burgers and shakes.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, excellent value

likes.liked: — Beautiful, comfortable, clean, and spacious room; wonderful amenities; excellent service & value

reviews.text: This hotel does have a nice location and there are plenty of restaurants and gas stations very close by.
reviews.title: Not Bad, Not Great An All Around Average Experience

reviews.text: The room was attractive and had a micro and fridge which I appreciate. The room was very clean and the bed comfy. I liked the fact that the windows had blinds between the panes of glass so I could get in a good amount of light and still have my privacy. They had expanded cable, which I also like when I travel for business.
reviews.title: Great place. Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problems I had in the room was that there was not a chair that could be used at the work table. there were two barrel chairs, but they are too low to be of any use. There was also no light by the couch. The couch itself seemed to be broken. It was a sleeper and when you sat on it, the cushions pushed down much more than they should have so that the back of your thighs was hit by the hard edge.
reviews.title: Excellent value :: loved staying in this hotel.

likes.liked: — Nothing particular, but overall everything was great.

reviews.text: The bathroom was your average bathroom, but boy was the fan loud!
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Best Place to Stay
reviews.text: Breakfast was very average, nothing to rave about.

I've stayed at Best Western Sault Ste Marie multiple times over the years, and I have consistantly had excellent experiences. In addition to the friendly and efficient staff and clean, comfortable rooms, on my most recent visit I was pleasantly surprised to find a new fitness center and onsite massage therapist to go along with the pool and sauna! Add to that the highspeed wireless internet access and the above-average continental breakfast (fresh waffles!!), and you've got a hotel that I will continue to come back to when I need a room in the Soo.
reviews.title: Deserves more stars!

reviews.text: I have stayed here on several occasions for multiple nights while visiting the Soo, photographing shipping. Always quick check-in, friendly staff and a nice breakfast including waffles and hostess with a smile. Highly recommended
reviews.title: Great Place
